definition: vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic

sentences.english: Vivid description of the teacher to read these words up.
sentences.chinese: 說罷老師就繪聲繪色地讀了起來。

sentences.english: The boy talked in an animated way about his trip to the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩繪聲繪色地談著他的熱帶叢林之行。

sentences.english: A piece of juicy gossip is going the rounds.
sentences.chinese: 一條繪聲繪色的小道消息正在傳來傳去。

sentences.english: The visitors also made a promise to the United States to describe a reporter twin cities story.
sentences.chinese: 這位美國客還繪聲繪色地給記者描述了一個雙城故事。

sentences.english: The speechmaker  dramatized his story with many gestures and actions.
sentences.chinese: 演講人用很多手勢和動作繪聲繪色地描述他的故事。

sentences.english: She gave a thrilling account of her life in the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 她繪聲繪色地描述了她在熱帶叢林中的生活。

sentences.english: The boy talks in an animated way about his trip to the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩繪聲繪色地談著他的熱帶叢林之行。

sentences.english: People talked about it vividly, as if they had all experienced it themselves.
sentences.chinese: 人們說得繪聲繪色，彷彿都親自經歷過一樣。

definition: to have no sense of shame/brazen
hard to tell if it's real or sham
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
lit. to bring a bramble and ask for punishment (idiom)/fig. to offer sb a humble apology
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
